summary: This Q&A discusses how people are put on the U.S. terrorist watchlist and redress options for those who say they were mistakenly added. Federal agencies use the list to share information about people who may pose terrorist threats. People may be added if they are—or are associated with—known or suspected terrorists. But people may also be misidentified as someone else who is on the list...
title: Terrorist Watchlist: Nomination and Redress Processes for U.S. Persons
